content:
**11. Fraud, Misstatement or Concealment**
Any fraud, misstatement or concealment in respect of this insurance or of any claim hereunder shall render this Policy null and void and any benefit due hereunder shall be or become forfeited.

**12. Free Look Period**
If this Policy shall have been issued and for any reason whatsoever You shall decide not to take up the Policy, You can return Your insurance by notifying Us in writing within fourteen (14) days from the date of delivery of the Policy. We will refund the Premium paid unless something has occurred for which a claim may be payable. The free look period will not apply to renewals of Your Policy with Us.

**13. Governing Law**
Any interpretation of this Policy relating to its construction, validity or operation shall be made in accordance with the Laws of Singapore.
questions: How does committing fraud, misstatement, or concealment affect the validity of the policy and the entitlement to benefits under this insurance?
What are the conditions and time limits for exercising the free look period to cancel the policy and obtain a premium refund, and how does a claim occurrence impact this refund?
Does the free look period apply to policy renewals, and what are the implications for a policyholder wishing to cancel a renewal?
In the event of a dispute regarding the interpretation or validity of the policy, which jurisdiction's laws govern the resolution of such issues?
If a policyholder submits a claim after committing misstatement or concealment, how does this affect the claim outcome and the overall policy status?
What documentation or notification requirements must be met within the fourteen-day free look period to validly cancel the policy and receive a refund?
How does the policy address situations where a claim event occurs during the free look period—does this negate the right to a refund?
Are there any exceptions or conditions under which the free look period might be extended beyond fourteen days or applied to renewals?
How does the governing law clause influence the interpretation of other policy provisions such as fraud or cancellation rights?
What is the consequence for benefits already paid if fraud or concealment is discovered after claim payment?
Can the policyholder rely on the free look period to cancel the policy if the policy was delivered but not yet activated or used for travel?
How does the policy define the start date for the free look period—does it begin from policy issuance, delivery, or another event?
If a policyholder attempts to conceal material facts during application but later discloses them within the free look period, how does this affect policy validity?
What are the procedural steps and timelines for notifying the insurer in writing to exercise the free look period cancellation?
In cases where the policyholder resides outside Singapore, how does the governing law clause affect dispute resolution and enforcement?
How does the policy handle situations where misstatement or concealment is unintentional versus deliberate in terms of policy nullification?
If a policyholder returns the policy within the free look period but a claim has already been made, how is the premium refund calculated or adjusted?
Does the policy specify any requirements for the form or content of the written notification to exercise the free look period?
How does the governing law clause interact with any international travel or cross-border claims under this policy?
What are the implications for a policyholder who attempts to claim benefits after the policy has been rendered null and void due to fraud or concealment?
